jobDescription: Email  LinkedIn  Twitter  Facebook  Google+Job DescriptionJob Description The exciting things you will be involved in include, but are not limited to the following:  Collaborating with key internal and external stakeholders to gather and analyze needs and requirements to design and implement robust analytic solutions to support the identified needs;  Accessing data, constructing and manipulating large datasets to support planned analyses, using SAS, SQL and similar tools;  Data access and preparation may resides directly with the Predictive Modeler or, depending on project complexity, delivery timelines, and resource availability, can be accomplished in collaboration with a statistical programmer, via definition of analytic dataset specification;  Developing, testing and deploying predictive models for patient level outcomes related utilization of prescription drug benefits and overall medical services;  Collaborating with other analytic resources to envision and prototype business intelligence tools based on the predictive modeling functionality;  Constructing and delivering written reports of the analytic findings in a variety of formats (reports, PPT, including visualization of data and findings), formulating recommendations, and effectively presenting the results to potential non-analytic audiences;  Tailoring the analytic solution to the specific client need and constraints of delivery timelines;  Applying creativity in developing analytic solutions based on available data sources, and in representing analytic findings in reports, tools, and other media to support most effective translation and application of internal and external customers;  Managing complex projects related to a wide variety of financial, utilization, and operational business needs. Required Qualifications To be considered for this exciting analytical opportunity, candidates will need to have a minimum of 3 years of professional experience in analysis of predictive modeling.  You will also need to have demonstrated experience in the following:  Constructing, validating, and maintaining predictive models;  Working with multiple business areas such as operations, finance, sales, product, and marketing;  Problem solving skills and experience constructing analytic solutions to business problems;  Developing innovative analytic approaches leveraging available internal and external data sources;  Data access and manipulation with SAS and retrieving data from large databases with SQL;  Working with administrative claims data such as pharmacy or medical claims;  Conducting data analysis in healthcare settings;  Experience interacting with and influencing decision-making by business audiences Preferred Qualifications Experience developing and applying forecasting methods and models;  Experience developing dashboards using visualization tools;  Working knowledge of health care industry products/services and operations  Healthcare claims data
